content.question: The figure above shows the graphs of <math alttext="y equals, the absolute value of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y equals, 6 minus x, minus x squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="negative 3 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-coordinates of the points of intersection of the graphs are <math alttext="x sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext=" x sub 1, is less than, x sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>. Which of the following gives the sum of the areas of the shaded regions?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, negative 3 to x sub 1, of, open parenthesis, 6 minus x, minus x squared, close parenthesis, d x, plus, the integral from, x sub 1 to x sub 2, of, the absolute value of x, end absolute value, d x, plus, the integral from, x sub 2 to 2, of, open parenthesis, 6 minus x, minus x squared, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, negative 3 to 2, of, open parenthesis, open parenthesis, 6 minus x, minus x squared, close parenthesis, minus, the absolute value of x, close parenthesis, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, negative 3 to x sub 1, of, the absolute value of x, end absolute value, d x, plus, the integral from, x sub 1 to x sub 2, of, open parenthesis, 6 minus x, minus x squared, close parenthesis, d x, plus, the integral from, x sub 2 to 2, of, the absolute value of x, end absolute value, d x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msubsup><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.6: Finding the Area Between Curves That Intersect at More Than Two Points
